title: U.S. Social Fragmentation at Multiple Scales — New England Complex Systems Institute

seo.description:
Despite global connectivity, societies seem to be increasingly polarized 
and fragmented. This phenomenon is rooted in the underlying complex 
structure and dynamics of social systems. Far from homogeneously mixing or 
adopting conforming views, individuals self-organize into groups at 
multiple scales, ranging from families up to cities and cultures.
